turns.content: Wow, that's a lot of characters! It sounds like you have a well-developed cast for your story. The different backgrounds and motivations for each character add depth and complexity to the story, and the division between the Renegades and the Gladiators creates conflict and tension. Additionally, the idea of characters having moles that can eventually be redeemed adds an interesting twist to the plot. Overall, it seems like you have a strong foundation for your story. Good luck with your writing!

The first part of the plot for the first chapter involved the amnesiacs waking up in separate locations. Yukiko wakes up first in an abandoned part of the tower basement, and causes takeshi's room to drop from the top of the tower, which wakes him up. They don't remember anything, and they don't know their names. They are instructed to climb a tower where the Gladiators are at by their inner demons. These inner demons also prompt the amnesiacs to technically demolish a slave encampment on the way to the tower by eliminating the encampment staff who were abusing the slaves (this introduces the player to the secret protagonists' feral state) once they finally make it too the top of the tower, they meet each other face to face for the first time and suddenly have a flashback of them fighting each other. They don't completely understand the flashback, but they are in a lot of pain and assume the other is the cause of their mental anguish. Yukiko wants to avoid Takeshi, however Takeshi attacks yukiko and wants answers. They cause an explosion and slowly fight their way down the tower, with yukiko making evasive maneuvers, and takeshi being a brute. Once they make it to the bottom, yukiko manages to trick Takeshi and trip him over the edge of a nearby cliff. However, because yukiko is not that strong, she falls in as well. Yukiko doesn't fall very far because she is able to catch herself, however Takeshi falls to the deepest part of the Ravine. This wasn't yukiko's intention, so she tried to go after Takeshi, but is too exhausted, and falls into the nearby river instead. This sets up Takeshi to be found by the Renegades and Yukiko to be found by the Gladiators. The first part ends as they fall unconscious in separate locations again. Would this be a good introduction for the amnesiacs? What are some ways to refine this first part of the plot?

This first part of the plot is a good introduction for the amnesiacs and sets up the premise of their amnesia and the conflict between them. It also establishes their inner demons and feral state, which adds to their character development. To refine this first part, you could consider adding more detail to the environment and setting to help the reader better visualize the world. Additionally, you could provide more context and hints about their past and the source of their amnesia, to build intrigue and keep the reader engaged. It could also be useful to develop the characters' motivations and personalities further, so that their actions and reactions are more relatable and understandable. Finally, consider adding more tension and suspense to the scene where Yukiko and Takeshi first meet, as this is a critical moment in the plot and can be used to further set the stage for the rest of the story.

Alright, I think I have some ideas. The next part of the plot is shortly after the amnesiacs fall unconscious. There was obviously a lot of commotion with the amnesiacs making a mess of the area. However, the organization can't investigate it themselves because they don't want to expose themselves. So they wake up the Gladiators and the Renegades to have them investigate the situation in their place. Each perspective starts with a cut scene explaining the character's experience in the Gladiator Trials, as well as their connection with the amnesiacs. Since the amnesiacs are unplayable at this moment, players playing the secret perspectives will switch to either Adelaide and Rhydderch depending on which amnesiac they chose to play as. This is also where a cutscene will play explaining Adelaide's and Rhydderch's experience in the trials as well as their childhood memory of their timetraveling hero. Once the cut scene finishes and each character is ready, they leave individual confinement and are introduced to the other characters on their respective teams. It's important to note that Damjan and Damia are not present in this section. The two are made to tame the amnesiacs mental instabilities, and sense the amnesiacs have technically switched places, the organization is waiting for when the amnesiacs are found before waking up the tamer twins and deploying them into their respective teams. After introductions, normally they would let the survivors chose which Platoon they want to be in and which people they want to work with. However because they are missing some people, they decide to postpone this and deploys everyone onto the field to find their missing members. This becomes the tutorial to the six main characters. What are some ways to refine this section?

Here are some suggestions for refining this section:

1. Develop the characters: Make sure to provide enough background information and context for the characters in the cutscenes, so that the players can understand who they are and what motivates them. This will help the players become invested in the characters and feel connected to them.
2. Provide more context: Provide more context on the situation with the amnesiacs and the reason for their investigation. This can include the impact of their actions and the consequences for both the organization and the survivors.
3. Add tension: Create a sense of urgency and tension around the investigation. This could be achieved through the use of music, sound effects, and visuals that emphasize the danger and uncertainty of the situation.
4. Make the tutorials interesting: Use the tutorials to introduce the gameplay mechanics in an engaging and entertaining way. This can be achieved by incorporating the mechanics into the storyline and making them an integral part of the investigation.
5. Introduce Damjan and Damia: Provide a brief introduction to Damjan and Damia and their role in the trials. This can help set the stage for their later appearance and give the players a sense of what is to come.
6. Add choice: Offer the players choices that affect the outcome of the investigation, such as which team they join and which characters they work with. This can increase player engagement and provide a sense of agency.

I can work with that. It's probably important to note that Yukiko was intended to join the Renegades and for Takeshi to join the Gladiators, as this would separate yukiko from Adelaide and takeshi from rhydderch, since the two pairs were very close. As such, Tamma is hoping they find Takeshi and yuudai is hoping to find yukiko. However, after some fighitng and searching, the Gladiators find yukiko and the Renegades find Takeshi. Tamma and Yuudai say they found the wrong person, and insist they keep searching, because it was stated the person they are looking for is the opposite gender. The team acknowledges this, however Adelaide and Rhydderch are adamant that they found the right person, and should be give medical assistance, as the amnesiac they found is unconscious with possible brain damage. The teams decide to keep searching at the insistence of Tamma and Yuudai, leaving Adelaide and Rhydderch behind with their respective amnesiac. Would it also make sense for Francessca and Eugene to stay behind with their respecitve amnesiac as well, since they were also close with them before their amnesia, and do not mistake Tamma/Yuudai for their mysterious friend back in the gladiator trials?

Yes, it makes sense for Francessca and Eugene to stay behind with their respective amnesiac, as they too were close with them prior to their amnesia. This would add an extra layer of tension to the situation, as Francessca and Eugene would be at odds with Tamma and Yuudai, who are still searching for the person they believe to be their true companion. Additionally, it would also reinforce the idea that the amnesiacs have switched places, and the true identity of each person is not yet clear. This could also create a parallel situation where Adelaide and Rhydderch are in a similar situation as Francessca and Eugene, as they both believe they have found the right person, but are at odds with the other members of their team.

Francessca, Adelaide, Eugene, and Rhydderch are still separated from their respective groups, and are not present when Damjan and Damia are introduced. Instead, the two parties take the time to fully tend to their respective unconscious amnesiacs, and find enough evidence to prove that their amnesiac is the same person as their mysterious friend from the gladiator trials (not only are the tools they have and use are similar, yukiko has the bracelet Adelaide made for her before the end of the trials, and Takeshi has the same scarf cloak Rhydderch gave him.) They also analyze that their friend has sustained some form of brain trauma, and may not remember things. Does it make sense for the two parties to Platoon up with their respective amnesiac without the agreement with the rest of the team? Would it make sense for them to suspect Tamma and Yuudai to be working against the amnesiacs? It is important to note that Platoon assignments are permanent, which is why everyone needs to be in agreement in which Platoon they want to be in.

Yes, it would make sense for Francessca, Adelaide, Eugene, and Rhydderch to Platoon up with their respective amnesiac based on the evidence they've gathered and their belief that their amnesiac is their mysterious friend from the Gladiator Trials. Their urgency to protect their friend and ensure their safety is likely a strong motivator for them to make this decision without the agreement of the rest of the team.

As for their suspicion towards Tamma and Yuudai, it would be understandable for Francessca, Adelaide, Eugene, and Rhydderch to have concerns given the conflicting information about the amnesiacs. Tamma and Yuudai's insistence on keeping the search going and their refusal to acknowledge the amnesiacs as their missing friends could be seen as suspicious behavior. However, it's also possible that Tamma and Yuudai have their own motivations and reasons for not accepting the amnesiacs right away, and it could be a point of tension and conflict within the game.
